reviewText:
I see a lot of negative reviews for this game and I really don't agree with them. This is a solid game with a very distinct art style. It looks really good and yet very simple, which is not a bad thing. The game is very easy to learn and is quite deep in it's ship customization and you will spend many hours designing and perfecting your ship designs. There is nothing more satisfying than having your custom badass capitalship send out a swarm of your custom fighters and totaly anhialate an enemy fleet.

Compared to a lot of other 4X games, Stardrive does not have as big of a techtree, there is still plenty of things to research but compared to games like Endless Space it's far from enough. One thing I really miss is more ways to improve your planets and concidering all the buildingspace you have left, there is room for a lot more.

Pros:
- Short learning curve
- Deep shipdesign
- Real-time gameplay
- Addicting

Cons:
- Not enough to research
- Ground battles
- Game crash after a few hours of play
- Save files are way to big

StarDrive is a game of immense depth. You are provided the option of designing your entire fleets to your specifications -- you can create ships using a variety of weapon types and defenses. reviewText:
I've decided to re-write this review as I feel I can offer a better oppinion at this point.

Right out the bag, this game is, in many ways absolutly incredible. The scale, depth and presentation is wonderful. The developer has managed to achive something amazing given both that this is his first game and that he's working solo.

The early game is wonderful, the ship designer is interesting, there's a good variety of planets, anomalies and the races all look brillient.

But, and it is a bit but, this game is also rather tragic. The potential it has was vast, and while some of it has been lived up to, due to poor engine choices and the dev choosing to remake the game in unity and create a sequal, the game is unlikely to get any better. Preformance is buggy, especialy later on. Late game is dull and will have you either compleatly dominate or be wiped out in the early game. Lack of multipalyer limits the games's life time signifigantly, and things such as the half finnished remnets plotline just make me want to cry.

That said, despite all it's faults I've still put in around 60 hours at time of writing, from multiple playthoughts, meaning that the cost per hour is less then 50p.

While the games has it's moments, the problems coupled with the fact that a remake and a sequal is arriving soon makes me recomend that you don't buy unless your fine with a incompleat, thought still impressive experiance. Wait till the sequal.

reviewText:
Runs at last, but...
No this game actually isn't bad. It's rather quite fine, but sadly also buggy. Some issues make it crash during diplomacy, others during deploying ground troops, and I also encountered a crash as I colonized a world.

The game looks neat, as far as it runs, it's of course not as polished as it could be, but there are already a lot of options. Sadly there is no more official support to this by the developer, but the fans still try to update it on a regular basis.

Pros:Collection of several races, that can even further be tweaked with traits.The player decides the size, and resources of the galaxy or sector. Systems can have a good variety of planets.
Cons:The game is buggy and crashing regulary, safe often.Not well supported by the developer, because the second part is out already.
Not recommended for everyone
The game is nice, sadly it's both no longer supported by the devs and it's buggy and crashy. But there still is hope, there is an inofficial patch for the game, that gets updated on a regular basis, and alone those Fanbase make the game still a good game. But, you have to know the basics of modding, and you have to keep in mind that the game still isn't running as smoothly as it should.

Given the issues with the bugs, crashes and lacking support, the positive things about the game are you can play it, though you will have to install and upkeep the patch. I encountered several problems during the first three or four tryouts, it's unclear why - because the final patching worked perfectly fine and I did nothing different.

If you are fan of the 4x Space Exploration genre, this game might be for you. Especially if you aren't afraid to mod your games and give it a try. But if you are inexperienced with modding, have problems with finetuning your software or system, then this game might be not for you - it will try out your patience and may pull the strings of your nerves.Don't buy the game when you want a fast, and relaxing playing experience.

Unless you are ready to micro manage the economy, agriculture, science , ship building, weapons, armor....\n\nI wouldnt recommend it for people looking to just jump in and start shooting and blasting everything. This game will require a whole new level of strategizing, diplomatic relations, conquering worlds for resources, going to war etc. I think if you can get the hang of it, it would be really fun. It defeinitely takes a person who is above average intelligence to really understand the game mechanics.
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText:
Recommending this as a yes because I love the concept.

But one should know its not without its issues, out of memory fatalities will mean you're lucky to complete a game without at least one crash, the user interface feels unfinished and there's a myriad of glitches that can be found.

That being said, the modding team has done an excellent job and attempted to fill a lot of the holes left by the original developer.

Overall I've enjoyed this game but the unfinished feel and lack of professional quality lets it down.

Recently went back and changed my review to a no, reasons include the above but mostly the game being a few years old and never fixing any of the major game breaking bugs, I've never managed to finish a game simply because it crashes repeatedly - and in my opinion I shouldn't have to mod to make a game function correctly.

I will reiterate the above, I actually love the concept and the ship design is superb, simply was never finished and cannot suggest anyone buy an unfinished product

reviewText: I really would LIKE to like this game. My favorite part about it is the races - they're very cool and very well designed, and have some great animated assets, and I love the take on race customization the game uses.\n\nUnfortunately, however, this game seems to have been thrown together in the 4X space formula without any polish, refinement, or novel central ideas, and the gameplay suffers terribly because of it. I literally cannot get through a full game in StarDrive. Everything is quirky, unbalanced, hard to find, and unpredictable. Even more of a shame considering the ship designer is one of the less obtuse examples I've seen in games like this. With a UI redesign and a lot of balancing and mechanical refinement, this could be a really cool game. But it's not, and the devs have abandoned it, so don't be fooled by the cool races and graphics.
